Detailed Description

Interface to the Octeon extended error status.

Revision
44252

Typedef Documentation

typedef int(* cvmx_error_func_t)(const struct cvmx_error_info *info)

Error handling functions must have the following prototype.

typedef struct cvmx_error_info cvmx_error_info_t

This structure is passed to all error handling functions.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum cvmx_error_flags_t

Flags representing special handling for some error registers.

These flags are passed to cvmx_error_initialize() to control the handling of bits where the same flags were passed to the added cvmx_error_info_t.

Enumerator:
CVMX_ERROR_FLAGS_ECC_SINGLE_BIT 
CVMX_ERROR_FLAGS_CORRECTABLE 
CVMX_ERROR_FLAGS_DISABLED 
enum cvmx_error_group_t

There are generally many error status bits associated with a single logical group.

The enumeration below is used to communicate high level groups to the error infastructure so error status bits can be enable or disabled in large groups.

Enumerator:
CVMX_ERROR_GROUP_INTERNAL 
CVMX_ERROR_GROUP_L2C 
CVMX_ERROR_GROUP_ETHERNET 
CVMX_ERROR_GROUP_MGMT_PORT 
CVMX_ERROR_GROUP_PCI 
CVMX_ERROR_GROUP_SRIO 
CVMX_ERROR_GROUP_USB 
CVMX_ERROR_GROUP_LMC 
CVMX_ERROR_GROUP_ILK 
CVMX_ERROR_GROUP_DFM 
CVMX_ERROR_GROUP_ILA 
enum cvmx_error_register_t

When registering for interest in an error status register, the type of the register needs to be known by cvmx-error.

Most registers are either IO64 or IO32, but some blocks contain registers that can't be directly accessed. A good example of would be PCIe extended error state stored in config space.

Enumerator:
__CVMX_ERROR_REGISTER_NONE 
CVMX_ERROR_REGISTER_IO64 
CVMX_ERROR_REGISTER_IO32 
CVMX_ERROR_REGISTER_PCICONFIG 
CVMX_ERROR_REGISTER_SRIOMAINT 
enum cvmx_error_type_t

Category the interrupt belongs to.

Enumerator:
CVMX_ERROR_TYPE_NONE 
CVMX_ERROR_TYPE_SBE 
CVMX_ERROR_TYPE_DBE

int __cvmx_error_decode ( const cvmx_error_info_t *  info  ) 

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Function for processing non leaf error status registers. This function calls all handlers for this passed register and all children linked to it.

Parameters:
info Error register to check
Returns:
Number of error status bits found or zero if no bits were set.
int __cvmx_error_display ( const cvmx_error_info_t *  info  ) 

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

This error bit handler simply prints a message and clears the status bit

Parameters:
info Error register to check
Returns:
void __cvmx_install_gmx_error_handler_for_xaui ( void   ) 
int cvmx_error_add ( const cvmx_error_info_t *  new_info  ) 

Register to be called when an error status bit is set.

Most users will not need to call this function as cvmx_error_initialize() registers default handlers for most error conditions. This function is normally used to add more handlers without changing the existing handlers.

Parameters:
new_info Information about the handler for a error register. The structure passed is copied and can be destroyed after the call. All members of the structure must be populated, even the parent information.
Returns:
Zero on success, negative on failure.
int cvmx_error_change_handler ( cvmx_error_register_t  reg_type,
uint64_t  status_addr,
uint64_t  status_mask,
cvmx_error_func_t  new_func,
uint64_t  new_user_info,
cvmx_error_func_t *  old_func,
uint64_t *  old_user_info 
)

Change the function and user_info for an existing error status register.

This function should be used to replace the default handler with an application specific version as needed.

Parameters:
reg_type Type of the status register to change
status_addr Status register to change.
status_mask All handlers for this status register with this mask will be changed.
new_func New function to use to handle the error status
new_user_info New user info parameter for the function
old_func If not NULL, the old function is returned. Useful for restoring the old handler.
old_user_info If not NULL, the old user info parameter.
Returns:
Zero on success, negative on failure

)

group Logical group to disable
xipd_port The IPD port value
Returns:
Zero.

int cvmx_error_disable_group ( cvmx_error_group_t  group,
int  group_index 
)

Disable all error registers for a logical group.

This should be called whenever a logical group is brought offline. Many blocks will report spurious errors when offline unless this function is called.

Parameters:
group Logical group to disable
group_index Index for the group as defined in the cvmx_error_group_t comments.
Returns:
Zero on success, negative on failure.
int cvmx_error_disable_group_type_v3 ( cvmx_error_group_t  group,
cvmx_error_type_t  type,
int  xipd_port

This should be called whenever a logical group is brought online.

type Category in a logical group to disable
xipd_port The IPD port value
Returns:

int cvmx_error_initialize ( cvmx_error_flags_t  flags  ) 

Initalize the error status system.

This should be called once before any other functions are called. This function adds default handlers for most all error events but does not enable them. Later calls to cvmx_error_enable() are needed.

Parameters:
flags Optional flags.
Returns:
Zero on success, negative on failure.
int cvmx_error_initialize_cn78xx ( int  node  ) 

Initalize the error status system for cn78xx.

This should be called once before any other functions are called. This function enables the interrupts described in the array.

Parameters:
node Node number
Returns:
Zero on success, negative on failure.

This should be called once before any other functions are called. This function enables the interrupts described in the array.

Returns:
Zero on success, negative on failure.

const void *  data

78xx related

Compare two INTSN values.

data current entry from the searched array
Returns:

int cvmx_error_poll ( void   ) 

Poll the error status registers and call the appropriate error handlers.

This should be called in the RSL interrupt handler for your application or operating system.

Returns:
Number of error handlers called. Zero means this call found no errors and was spurious.
int cvmx_error_remove ( cvmx_error_register_t  reg_type,
uint64_t  status_addr,
uint64_t  status_mask,
cvmx_error_info_t *  old_info 
)

Remove all handlers for a status register and mask.

Normally this function should not be called. Instead a new handler should be installed to replace the existing handler. In the even that all reporting of a error bit should be removed, then use this function.

Parameters:
reg_type Type of the status register to remove
status_addr Status register to remove.
status_mask All handlers for this status register with this mask will be removed.
old_info If not NULL, this is filled with information about the handler that was removed.
Returns:
Zero on success, negative on failure (not found).
void cvmx_octeon_hang ( void   ) 

This function powers down all other cores and suspends the current core.
